intro: Spennera alata, commonly known as the winged spennera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its stems, which give it its common name. Spennera alata produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
